significative adjective
(SYMBOL)
language
  usually specialized acting as a sign or symbol of something: He employs a variety of strategies in an attempt to increase the significative force texts are able to generate. The simple, significative nature of language sometimes appears rather uncertain.
More examplesFewer examplesThese dots do not seem to be decorative, but function as numerals, and are significative in this case. Was there any individual awareness of the significative process of these religious rituals within the culture?
